data.title: Disappointed
data.text:
Have lived in North Port for 3 years and the Rice House had become one of my favorite Chinese restaurants.  There are only a few Thai dishes so it really isn't a Thai restaurant.  I ordered there just about every week.

Last few times I ordered, my food quality and quantity was disappointing.  Asked for General Tso's Chicken to be extra extra crispy and it was not crispy at all.  They don't fill containers as tight as other Chinese Restaurants.  

Then, the last time I ordered, was a little odd.  I walked in and asked if I was too late to order off the lunch menu.  She said yes.  I asked by how much, 2 minutes?  She looks at me and said 1 minute!!!  Mind you, I was a regular customer and 1 minute was a big deal to her to not let me order off the lunch menu???!  Rules are rules, but maybe their clock is faster than mine or vice versa.  When I questioned it, she said that what I ordered wasn't on the lunch menu anyhow.  I told her that I could order something else.  Order wasn't changed and I paid regular price with a 10% off coupon which is a lesser amount off than the lunch menu vs. dinner menu cost.  I hope the few dollars was worth losing a good customer.  To me, it wasn't so much the money amount, it was the principle of the whole thing.

Another thing that bothers me is that they go into the dining room area and fill wontons for soup where people are dining.  Not very sanitary.

Last week was the last time I will be ordering from this restaurant.  The people are nice, but that doesn't make up for food quality, quantity and being 1 minute late to order off lunch menu.  Not a good way to treat customers if you really want them to come back.

data.title: not good
data.text: Went there for dinner and the service was very bad . The food was small portions and the food was not all the good . Will not be going back there again . Looking for a new place to go in the area.

data.title: Disappointing
data.text: The prices are reasonable but, I would gladly pay more for food that was more palatable.i would not go backThe restaurant was clean and service was good but, the food was very disappointing. I would not go back again.

data.title: It's really a quaint place to eat.
data.text: I have been many times to the Rice House. Their menus is great and food is delicious. Prices are great too and portions and very generous.

data.title: Dinner
data.text: The best Chinese food in North Port. Singapore Chicken Mie Fun is to die for. Get it every time we visit along with the egg drop soup.

data.title: Terrible food
data.text: Have yet to find a good Chinese food place in the North Port area, but this one was horrible. Could not even eat their shrimp fried rice as it has a nasty taste to it.

data.title: Excellent Chinese food!
data.text: Went for lunch the first time, then ordered take-out.  The food was delicious both times.  My only criticism is that the honeygarlic chicken had no discernible garlic.  The prices are fair, but be careful, they charge for each pot of tea.

data.title: RICE HOUSE REVISITED.....FANTASTIC CRISPY DUCK
data.text: Ibhave previously reviewed this resturant and it was not very complimentary. Guess what, there has been a total change in ownership. The food's quality has improved dramaticaly and the delivery time has inproved greatly. The best thing on the menu is the fresh Crisy Boneless 1/2 Duck. This dish is not prepared by many Chinese restaurants in South West Florida. Its a little pricey at $16.75 per order , but its enough for 2 large sized meals. Try it I assure you that you will enjoy it!

data.title: First and last visit
data.text: We were visiting the area had a taste for Thai food.  We decided to try the Chinese options on the menu rather the Thai.  The bowl of complimentary wonton chips (? ) were stale and broken when they arrived at our table.   We ordered egg rolls, crispy orange chicken and garlic pepper pork. The egg rolls were mediocre, the garlic pepper pork had little pepper, little garlic, and the pork strips were anemic looking.  The orange chicken was crispy and tasty but tasted more like sweet and sour chicken. The wait staff was friendly but the quality of the food was very disappointing.

data.title: Cheep and Plentiful Thai + Chinese
data.text: This restaurant has been a favorite or ours due to the value.  They have Chinese and Thai cuisine.  We got to know the old owners family, but now they have new owners.  I recommend the coconut soup.

data.title: Cheap and Good Food
data.text: Their Thai Pad Thai was delicious and so were their Thai Teas. The staff was also friendly although their waitress should work on her English a little more.

data.title: Disappointing
data.text: We enjoyed the Rice House when we visited North Port last year, but the food was not good this time around.

data.title: Save Youe Money
data.text: It was once one of the best Asian restaurants in town.  I have now switch my allegiance to China 1 at 19451 Cochran Blvd in Port Charlotte.

data.title: Rice house under new management and not as good .
data.text: This Chinese restaurant use to be one of if not the best eat in Chinese restaurants in North Port, fl. No longer is that the case. The food was not nearly as good as it use to be and the service is lacking. Go to china Wok and take out before going to the Rice house.

data.title: Take your $$$ and RUN!
data.text: Just moved to North Port and thought I had ordered from this place previously but boy was I wrong.  Took two hours to deliver.  Then the food was horrible.  Steaks on a stick are really thick and full of grizzle.  Bourbon chicken unrecognizable.  Tiny portions of rice and the smallest frozen eggroll I have seen on the planet.  The woman that took the order.....she tried to be professional but seemed totally lost, even though I had my order number.  Note to self and others: The correct place to order from in North Port has the word Asia in it.

data.title: Finally
data.text: Since moving to North Port we haven't been very happy with any of the Asian restaurants here.  A friend recommended Rice House.  What a yummy surprise.

data.title: Very good, and priced right.
data.text:
Aside from the fact the inside of the dining area could use a little TLC, this place is GOOD. The girls who work there are there like every day. They are very accommodating, they do not nickle and dime every little substitution like some places. You can order any item on the menu with no added MSG. Everything I have ordered has been good including -

Chop Suey
Tofu and Vegetables
Mei Fun
Chili Fried Tofu
Veggie Delight
Vegetable Rolls

A single dinner is just under 9 bucks and is enough food for a normal sized eater. Make your white rice a large for an extra buck.

data.title: Good Food
data.text: Very good food and prices. Staff is very friendly! We get takeout food from here often! Never had any problems here whatsoever!

data.title: Lunchtime first time
data.text: i can't believe this cute little place is so close to home. When you get there, they bring out these wonton strips and a sweet dipping sauce.  Yummy.  I got shrimp with garlic sauce and hubby got generals tso's chicken. He said his was really good. Mine was better than good.  The flavor was so good and has a nice combination of veggies.  The rice wa absolutely the best fried rice I have ever eaten.  The pork chunks in it were actually tender and not small little cubes of chewy meat surprise.  I can't wait to go again.

data.title: Delivery.
data.text: We always order delivery. The food is good, the delivery is fast. The driver is always nice. Never had a bad experience with the delivery. Our favorite is the sweet and sour chicken, pork fried rice and egg rolls. We like the combo meals. Never had any problems with this restaurant.
